MASWE-0086: SQL Injection
MASWE-0064: Insecure Content Providers + MASWE-0086: SQL Injection
MASWE-0085: Unsafe Dynamic Code Loading

Vulnerability: Key to encrypted SQLite database stored locally (retrievable)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0014: Cryptographic Keys Not Properly Protected at Rest + MASWE-0020: Improper Encryption

Vulnerability: Memory dumps leaking sensitive data (decrypted keys, etc)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0082: Unsafe Handling of Data From Local Storage

Vulnerability: Obtaining access to app logs via InsecureLoggerService. Leak of credentials in LoginActivity Log.d("ovaa", "Processing " + loginData). (Insecure logging of sensitive user data)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0001: Insertion of Sensitive Data into Logs

Vulnerability: Use of the hardcoded AES key in WeakCrypto. (crypto/key management failure)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0013: Hardcoded Cryptographic Keys in Use

Vulnerability: Arbitrary login url via deeplink leaking sensitive user data (Platform IPC/manifest concern/issue)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0058: Insecure Deep Links

Vulnerability: Obtaining access to arbitrary content providers via deeplink (Misuse of content provider permissions semantics and intent flags)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0066: Insecure Intents + MASWE-0064: Insecure Content Providers

Vulnerability: Vulnerable host validation when processing deeplink (Incorrect origin/host validation & WebView/deeplink platform integration issue)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0058: Insecure Deep Links

Vulnerability: Opening arbitrary URLs via deeplink (Unsafe WebView configuration)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0070: JavaScript Loaded from Untrusted Sources

Vulnerability: Access to arbitrary activities and access to arbitrary content providers via arbitrary Intent object (Insecure Intent handling)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0066: Insecure Intents

Vulnerability: Theft of arbitrary files in MainActivity by intercepting an activity launch from Intent.ACTION_PICK and passing the URI to any file as data. (broken intent/URI handling & insufficient URI validation when interacting with platform picker)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0066: Insecure Intents + MASWE-0064: Insecure Content Providers

Vulnerability: Insecure broadcast to MainActivity containing credentials. The attacker can register a broadcast receiver with action oversecured.ovaa.action.UNPROTECTED_CREDENTIALS_DATA and obtain the user's data. (Unsafe broadcast IPC and exposed receiver -> platform ipc misconfiguration)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0063: Insecure Broadcast Receivers

Vulnerability: Insecure activity launch in MainActivity with action oversecured.ovaa.action.WEBVIEW, containing the user's encrypted data in the query parameter token. (Sensitive data passed via intents/URIs — unsafe use of platform IPC)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0066: Insecure Intents + ?MASWE-0053: Sensitive Data Leaked via the User Interface?

Vulnerability: Obtaining read/write access to arbitrary files in TheftOverwriteProvider via path-traversal in the value uri.getLastPathSegment(). (ContentProvider implementation mistake (platform component) that allows directory traversal)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0064: Insecure Content Providers + MASWE-0081: Unsafe Handling Of Data From External Interfaces

Vulnerability: Use of very wide file sharing declaration for oversecured.ovaa.fileprovider content provider in root entry. (Manifest/provider configuration that exposes files system-wide — platform config issue)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0064: Insecure Content Providers

Vulnerability: Deletion of arbitrary files via the insecure DeleteFilesSerializable deserialization object. (Insecure Deserialization)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0088: Insecure Object Deserialization

Vulnerability: Hardcoded credentials to a dev environment endpoint in strings.xml in test_url entry. (Hardcoded sensitive data)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0005: API Keys Hardcoded in the App Package

Vulnerability: Arbitrary code execution via a DEX library located in a world-readable/writable directory. (Unsafe runtime code loading from writable locations enables tampering / arbitrary code injection)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0085: Unsafe Dynamic Code Loading

Vulnerability: Memory corruption via the MemoryCorruptionParcelable object.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0088: Insecure Object Deserialization

Vulnerability: Memory corruption via the MemoryCorruptionSerializable object.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0088: Insecure Object Deserialization

Vulnerability: Arbitrary Code Execution in OversecuredApplication by launching code from third-party apps with no security checks. (Allowing external code execution undermines runtime integrity / tamper resistance)
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0085: Unsafe Dynamic Code Loading

Vulnerability: Insecure Data Storage: The app stores user credentials locally without encrypting them.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0006: Sensitive Data Stored Unencrypted in Private Storage Locations

Vulnerability: Insecure Logging: User credentials are leaked in logcat. Only attackers with physical access to the device can access this information.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0001: Insertion of Sensitive Data into Logs

Vulnerability: AWS Cognito Misconfiguration: The misconfigured AWS cognito instance can be used to accesss AWS S3 bucket.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0033: Authentication or Authorization Protocol Security Best Practices Not Followed

Vulnerability: Hardcoded Credentials: Credentials are hardcoded somewhere that can be used to login to the application
MASVS Counterpart: ?MASWE-0005: API Keys Hardcoded in the App Package?

Vulnerability: Lack of SSL Certificate Validation: The unsafe implementation of OnReceived SSL Error can be used to eavesdrop all the traffic loaded in webview.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0052: Insecure Certificate Validation

Vulnerability: Insufficient URL Validation: Possible to load any arbitrary URL in webview via Deeplink.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0058: Insecure Deep Links

Vulnerability: Weak Host Validation Check: Possible to bypass host validation check to load any arbitrary URL in webview.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0071: WebViews Loading Content from Untrusted Sources

Vulnerability: Arbitrary Code Execution: Arbitrary Code Execution via third-party package contexts.
MASVS Counterpart: ?MASWE-0107: Runtime Code Integrity Not Verified?

Vulnerability: Access to Protected Components: The app takes an embedded Intent and passes it to method like startActivity. This allows any third party app to launch any protected component.
MASVS Counterpart: ?MASWE-0066: Insecure Intents?

Vulnerability: Unprotected Data URIs: The untrusted URI's passed via loadUrl method allows attackers to pass arbitrary URL in webview.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0071: WebViews Loading Content from Untrusted Sources

Vulnerability: Theft of Arbitrary: Possible to steal files from app's local storage via ChooserActivity.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0066: Insecure Intents

Vulnerability: Insecure Broadcast Receiver: An exported activity registers a broadcast during onCreate method execution. An attacker can trigger this broadcast and provide arbitrary URL in 'web_url' parameter.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0063: Insecure Broadcast Receivers

Vulnerability: Insecure use of FilePaths in FileProvider: The use of wide file sharing declaration can be used to access root directory via content Provider.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0064: Insecure Content Providers

Vulnerability: Use of Implicit intent to send a broadcast with sensitive data: The use of Implicit intent can allow third-party apps to steal credentials.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0066: Insecure Intents

Vulnerability: Intercepting Implicit intent to load arbitrary URL: The use of Implicit intent can allow third-party apps to load any arbitrary URL in webview.
MASVS Counterpart: ?MASWE-0066: Insecure Intents?

Vulnerability: Insecure Implementation of SetResult in exported Activity: The insecure implementation used in ResultActivity can be used to access arbitrary content providers.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0066: Insecure Intents

Vulnerability: Insecure Content Provider: The content provider can be accessed by any third-party app to steal user credentials.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0064: Insecure Content Providers

Vulnerability: Insecure Webview Properties Enabled: Insecure Webview properties are enabled that can allow third-party apps to exfiltrate local data to remote domain.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0069: WebViews Allows Access to Local Resources

Vulnerability: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities: Identify the vulnerable components or libraries used in the app that can allow you to exfiltrate local files to remote domain.
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0104: App Integrity Not Verified
MASWE-0066: Insecure Intents

Vulnerability: Exported BroadcastReceiver, sendBroadcast with implicit Intent
MASVS Counterpart: MASWE-0063: Insecure Broadcast Receivers
MASWE-0066: Insecure Intents
